protocol.name: P-AFFY-2
protocol.text: Labeling of samples was carried out according to the manufacturer’s standard protocol

protocol.name: P-MTAB-24228
text: Wild-type Columbia seeds transformed with the ML1:FUS3:GR construct were sterilized by vigorously shaking in 800 uL of 20% bleach (7:3) for 5 minutes and rinsed 5X in sterilized water. Seeds were sown on filter paper placed above 0.5X MS 0.8% agar media plates and imbibed for five days at 4 degrees C. To minimize the effects of biological variation, we followed a pooling strategy after Zhu et al. (2003) in which approximately 100 individual plants per replicate experiment were harvested and pooled before RNA extraction and hybridization. The seedlings were then transferred to 20 degrees C for five days. Shoot tissue from seedlings were collected for RNA isolation (Day 5). The remaining seedlings on the filter paper were transferred to either MS plates consisting of 1 ﾵM DEX or the same amount of DMSO. Two and four days after the transfer, shoot tissue was collected from seedlings to obtain RNA samples for Day 7 and Day 9, respectively. The above protocol was repeated to obtain replicate samples.
(Parameters: time unit = seconds, temperature unit = C, media = 1/2 x MS)

protocol.name: P-MTAB-24229
protocol.text: Five-day old seedlings on the filter paper were transferred to either MS plates consisting of 1 ﾵM DEX or the same amount of DMSO. Two and four days after the transfer, shoot tissue was collected from seedlings to obtain RNA samples for Day 7 and Day 9, respectively.

protocol.name: P-MTAB-24230
protocol.text: Five, seven and nine-day old seedlings were ground in liquid nitrogen. Total RNA was extracted by a Trizol-based method.  (Parameters: Extracted product = total_RNA, Amplification = none)
